title: John F. Cowell
text:
John Francis Cowell (March 3, 1852 – May 1, 1915) was an American <a href="botanist">botanist</a>. He was the first director of the <a href="Buffalo%20and%20Erie%20County%20Botanical%20Gardens">Buffalo and Erie County Botanical Gardens</a>. Cowell was born in <a href="Wrentham%2C%20Massachusetts">Wrentham, Massachusetts</a> and studied <a href="law">law</a> in <a href="Boston">Boston</a>.
Cowell practiced law in <a href="St.%20Paul%2C%20Minnesota">St. Paul, Minnesota</a> and moved to <a href="Buffalo%2C%20New%20York">Buffalo, New York</a> in 1874. He was a school principal and professor of botany at the <a href="University%20at%20Buffalo%2C%20The%20State%20University%20of%20New%20York">University at Buffalo</a> before accepting the position of director of the botanical gardens in 1894.
He died of a heart attack while collecting plants in <a href="East%20Aurora%2C%20New%20York">East Aurora, New York</a>.
